clinical_study.brief_title: B-SAFER: Branched Stented Anastomosis Frozen Elephant Trunk Repair
clinical_study.official_title: B-SAFER: Branched Stented Anastomosis Frozen Elephant Trunk Repair

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective, single-center, non-blind, non-randomized safety and feasibility study of the hybrid repair of thoracic aortic pathologies requiring repair of the aortic arch proximal to the origin of innominate artery.

detailed_description.textblock: The proposed Investigational Device Exemption (IDE) is to assess the safety and preliminary effectiveness of the simplified hybrid frozen elephant trunk repair technique Branched Stented Anastamosis Frozen Elephant Trunk Repair (B-SAFER) which involves a physician modified endovascular stentgraft to treat the proximal aorta in subjects with aortic disease involving multiple segments. The study will also evaluate the device functionality when using this operative technique for device implantation including multiple components.

primary_outcome.description: Individual rate of occurrence of the death from all-cause
Individual rate of occurrence of stroke
Individual rate of occurrence of paralysis
Composite of the following criteria: successful delivery of the device through the vasculature, successful deployment of the device at the intended location, and patient survival

primary_outcome.time_frame: At hospital discharge or at 1 month
primary_outcome.description: Patent graft/endografts confirmed by CT imaging assessment

primary_outcome.measure: Complete sealing of the aortic pathology
primary_outcome.description: Absence of Type Ia and IIIa/b endoleak, complete coverage of PAU cases, and isolation of the primary entry tear in dissection cases confirmed by CT imaging assessment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 months after the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Individual rate of the aortic related death

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 months after the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Individual rate of the pseudoaneurysm at the treatment sites

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 months after the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Individual rate of the unanticipated aortic or branch-related re-operation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 months after the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Individual rate of the Type I endoleak confirmed by CT imaging assessment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 months after the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Individual rate of the Type III endoleak confirmed by CT imaging assessment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 months after the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Individual rate of non-cardiac/non-aortic re-operations

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 months after the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Individual rate of vocal cord paralysis

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 months after the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Individual rate of myocardial infarction

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 months after the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Individual rate of respiratory failure

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 months after the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Individual rate of renal failure requiring dialysis

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 months after the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Individual rate of thromboembolic events

secondary_outcome.measure: Failed patencies in graft, or endovascular stent-graft including the branch(es)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 months after the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Individual rate of failed patencies in gaft or endovascular stent-graft including branch(es)

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary unplanned interventions in the treated vascular segment or related to the original pathology
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 months after the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Individual rate of secondary unplanned interventions in the treated vascular segment or related to the original pathology

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 months after the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Individual rate of aortic rupture

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 months after the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Individual rate of device integrity failures confirmed by CT imaging assessment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 months after the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Individual rate of device crimping/kinking confirmed by CT imaging assessment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 months after the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Individual rate of device migration (>10 mm based on the position of the device implantation) compared to baseline confirmed by CT imaging assessment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 months after the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Individual rate of thrombosis of the device lumen confirmed by CT imaging assessment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 months after the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Individual rate of surgical graft/stentgraft infection

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 months after the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Individual rate of all endoleak types confirmed by CT imaging assessment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 months after the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Individual rate of distal extension migration (>10 mm based on the position of the device implantation) confirmed by CT imaging assessment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 months after the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Individual rate of non-serious adverse events

secondary_outcome.measure: Failure of device-extension integrity resulting in a compromised seal and blood leakage or movement of the device
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 months after the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Individual rate of the extension device integrity issues confirmed by CT imaging assessment

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Type III endoleak related to the extension device
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 months after the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Individual rate of the Type III endoleak related to the extension device confirmed by CT imaging assessment

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of failed patency of the device-extension overlap
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 months after the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Individual rate of failed patency of the device-extension overlap confirmed by CT imaging assessment

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of MAE at 30 days post-extension
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 months after the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Individual rate and type of MAE at 30 days post-extension

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of secondary procedures related to the extension
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 months after the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Individual rate secondary procedures related to the extension

arm_group.description: Implantation of a physician-modified endovascular stentgraft(s) to treat the proximal aorta in subjects with aortic disease involving multiple segments.

intervention.description: Simplified hybrid frozen elephant trunk repair will be performed by utilizing B-SAFER technique which involves a physician modified endovascular stentgraft to treat the proximal aorta in subjects with aortic disease involving multiple segments.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. At least 18 years of age
2. Subject is willing and able to give written informed consent to participate in the study or the subject's legally authorized representative has given written informed consent for the subject to participate in the study.
3. Expected life expectancy of greater than two years after repair
4. Subject has aortic pathology and requires repair or replacement of multiple damaged or diseased segments of the thoracic aorta (at least one of the following condition): Thoracic aortic aneurysm considered at increased risk for rupture or complications, Acute aortic dissection requiring urgent repair, Congenital aortic disease requiring repair
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subject is unfit for open surgical repair involving circulatory arrest
2. Subject is comatose or suffering from irreversible severe brain malperfusion
3. Subject has known sensitivity to components of the devices
4. Subject has an active systemic infection that, in the opinion of the investigator, would compromise the outcome of the surgical procedure
5. Subject is enrolled in another active study and has received an investigational product (device, pharmaceutical or biologic) within 6 months prior to the date of the implant or has not reached the primary endpoint of the study
6. Subject has an uncorrectable bleeding anomaly
7. Subject has any other medical, social or psychological problems that in the opinion of the investigator preclude them from receiving this treatment and the procedures and evaluations pre- and post- procedure
8. Subject is pregnant
